page.title: 10EVENTS_TWINNING
page.content: The first Saturday in May is traditionally Wath Folk Festival. 4th May 85 was marked by a Twinning Ceremony. The day began with Maypole dancing by Brampton Ellis, Wath C. of E. and St. Mary's R.C. Junior School teams followed by Wath Morris Men and visiting teams. At 11.30 hrs. the Twinning Ceremony joining Wath-upon-Dearne to St.Jean de Bournay took place. Speeches were made in English and French by Terry Stables (Chairman of Wath Community Assoc.),Mme. Brigitte Bouvier (President Les Amis du Jumelage),Coun. Etchells (Mayor of Rotherham) and Mme. Claire Delage (Mayor of St.Jean de Bournay). The Mayors signed the Agreement/Oath and exchanged gifts. After a service of Dedication the Vicar, Rev. J. Packer threw bread from the Church Tower.
